item.title: R to @Fabien_UX: The ‚Äúvalue umbrella‚Äù an entrant like apple can use in FS is huge. Take lower margin, act more in the interests of the user, but still add vastly to corporate profit is huge‚Ä¶. But consumers would benefit.

item.title:
RT by @paulhodgson: Our shopping habits are under threat
Some radicals are seeking to force us to use weights and measures we didn‚Äôt grow up with
If you want to conserve the Britain we know and retain the gram and kilo, respond to this consultation
https://www.gov.uk/government/consultations/choice-on-units-of-measurement-markings-and-sales

item.title: RT by @paulhodgson: It's worth mentioning how important this statistic is. There are hundreds of users across the UK that visit http://GOV.UK using a game console, at the bottom of the image is a list of pages they primarily visit. Among the top visited pages are ones for Universal Credit.
item.dc:creator: @TheRealNooshu

item.title: R to @CalDigit: Just to close the loop on this: updating macOS and replacing a faulty external ssd means the ts4 now works perfectly and I wouldn‚Äôt be without it. Brilliant product.

item.title: RT by @paulhodgson: Friendly reminder that Elon Musk told the UN that if they gave him a budgeted breakdown of how $6Bil could end world hunger, he would do it. They gave him the budget and then he decided not to do it, and instead decided he would buy Twitter for $45Bil.
item.dc:creator: @CaptAmazo
item.description:
Friendly reminder that Elon Musk told the UN that if they gave him a budgeted breakdown of how $6Bil could end world hunger, he would do it. They gave him the budget and then he decided not to do it, and instead decided he would buy Twitter for $45Bil.
